graph-visualization-notes Bibliographic notes
ALGORITHMS
Primary sources: Chapters at - Didimo and Liotta 2007 in Cook and Holder 2007 (succinct survey) - Skiena 2008 (sections for arbitrary graphs, trees, and planar graphs)
Force-directed drawing:
CH: Most force-directed algorithms described in the literature adopt the physical model by Eades Eades 1984 and propose variants of the forces definition - Kamada Kamada and Kawai 1989 Kamada and Kawai 1991 - FR Fruchterman and Reingold 1991 - Magnetic spring model Sugiyama and Misue 1995 - Adaptive model Frick et al. 1995 - Simulated annealing Davidson and Harel 1996
CH: An experimental comparison of graph drawing algorithms based on force-directed methods is described in Brandenburg et al. 1996.
Hierarchical drawing Bastert and Matuszewski 2001 Di Battista et al. 1998 - Sugiyama et al. 1981 - Gansner et al. 1993 - Buchheim et al. 2000
Metrics: - Tamassia 1985 Batini et al. 1986 Tamassia 1987: Embedded planar graph with vertices having at most four incident edges - Kandisky drawings Fossmeier and Kaugmann 1997: graphs of any vertex degree
TOOLS: - Design patterns Heer and Agrawala 2006 - JSNVA network drawing framework Ye et al. 2008 - VisNetMiner Shi et al. 2009
+ Force-directed: Pajek de Nooy et al. 2005, NodeXL Hansen et al. 2010... + Hierarchical drawing: The methodology of Sugiyama et al. 1981 is used by Graphviz Ellson et al. 2003, Ptolomaeus Di Battista et al. 1998...
Monographs Di Battista et al. 1999 - Recent survey of visualization techniques Aigner et al. 2011 - Focus on software: the development and evaluation of methods for graphically representing different aspects of software, including its structure, its execution, and its evolution Sugiyama 2002; Diehl 2007 - Focus on biology: Guimera and Nunes 2005 - General literature on visualization, what makes visualization aesthetically pleasing Cleveland 1985 Tufte 2001 Steele and Iliinsy 2010
- Planar graphs Nishizeki and Rahman 2004
Annual conference on graph drawing GD (proceedings published by Springer-Verlag's Lecture Notes in Computer Science series), since 1992: http://graphdrawing.org/
